parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A dinner, an afternoon or evening meal. From the same as dapane; dinner, i.e. The chief meal.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To put, place, lay, set, fix, establish. A prolonged form of a primary theo to place.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A long flowing outer garment, tunic. Neuter of a presumed derivative of ennumi; a dress.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To gird, tie around; mid: I gird round myself. From dia and zonnumi; to gird tightly.
A towel, apron, coarse cloth. Of Latin origin; a 'linen' cloth, i.e. Apron.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
